document.docTitle: Sinella hunanica Zhao & Zhang, 2016, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: New cave species of Sinella Brook, 1882 from China (Collembola: Entomobryidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New cave species of Sinella Brook, 1882 from China (Collembola: Entomobryidae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Figs 2 , 24‒37 , Table 1

Types .
Holotype : female on slide, China : Hunan Province : Bingzhou : Wanhua cave, 112.595°E , 25.698°N , altitude
340 m
,
23.viii.2015
, Sunbin HUANG , Xinhui WANG , Minruo TANG and Pinjing YANG leg
.
(collection # 15cave4). Paratypes : female on slide, same data as holotype. All material deposited in NJAU
.
Description. Body length up to 1.8 mm . Body pale in alcohol ( Fig. 2 ).
Ant. II‒IV lost in all specimens. Smooth spiny mic at base of antennae 3 dorsal and 3 ventral on Ant. I. Long smooth straight chaetae 7 ventral on Ant. I.

Th. II with 5(4, 6) (m1, m 1i , m2, m 2i , m 2i 2) medio-medial, 3 (m4, m 4i , m4p) medio-lateral, 19‒24 posterior mac, 1 ms and 2 sens; ms inner to sens; m 1i rarely absent; m2e and m 2i 3 only present on one side in one specimen. Th. III with 31‒40 mac and 2 lateral sens; a7, m7, m 5i and a 6i as mac ( Fig. 34 ). Abd. I with 7 (a2, a3, m2–4, m 2i , m4p) mac, 1 ms and 1 sens; sens inner to ms. Abd. II with 3 (m3, m3e, m3ep) central, 1 (m5) lateral mac and 2 sens. Abd. III with 1 (m3) central, 3 (am6, pm6, p6) lateral mac and 2 sens; ms absent ( Fig. 35 ). Abd. IV with 7 central (I, M, A5, A6, B4‒6) and 6 lateral mac (D3, E2–4, E2p, F1) ( Fig. 36 ); two sens (as, ps) of normal length and others elongate (not represented). Abd. V with 3 sens ( Fig. 37 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 24–33.
Sinella hunanica
sp. nov.
: 24, maxillary outer lobe; 25, lateral process of labial palp; 26, labial and postlabial chaetae, arrow indicating the chaeta may be absent; 27, trochanteral organ; 28, middle claw; 29, hind claw; 30, posterior face and lateral flap of ventral tube; 31, distal part of manubrium ventrally; 32, manubrial plaque; 33, mucro.

FIGURES 34–37. Tergal chaetotaxy in
Sinella hunanica
sp. nov.
: 34, thorax; 35, Abd. I–III; 36, Abd. IV; 37, Abd. V.

subSubSection.paragraph: Ecology. In cave.
Etymology. Named after its type locality.

Remarks.
Sinella hunanica
sp. nov.
is most similar to
S. sineocula
in 8 cephalic sutural chaetae, labial chaetae, ciliate post-labial chaetae X and X2‒4 , claw structure, “smooth” inner differentiated tibiotarsal chaetae, and chaetotaxy of Th. III‒Abd. IV, but differs from the latter in 4 mac in Gr. II on dorsal head, presence of mac m 1i and m 2i 2 on Th. II, pointed tenent hairs, and short mucronal spine.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1. Comparison of
S. hunanica
sp. nov.
,
S. liuae
sp. nov.
and
S. sineocula Chen & Christiansen, 1993
(+, present; –, absent).

tr.th: Number of chaetae on trochanteral organ
Number of mac in Gr. II on dorsal head
Mac m1i and m2i2 on Th. II
Number of central mac on Abd. IV

Sinella tigris
sp. nov.
Figs 38–55, Table 2

subSubSection.paragraph:
Types .
Holotype : female on slide, China : Guangxi : Baise : Longlin Xian : Longhuo : Lao Hu Dong , 105.587˚E, 24.497˚N, altitude
1080 m
,
20. iv.2010
, L. Deharveng and A. Bedos leg. (collection # CHIgx10-38)
.
Paratypes : female and male on slides and 10 in alcohol, same data as holotype
. Holotype and one male paratype deposited in NJAU and others in MNHN.
Description. Body length up to 4.5 mm . Body white or weakly scattered with reddish pigment.

Antennae 2.5–2.9 times as long as cephalic diagonal. Antennal segments ratio as I: II: III: IV = 1: 1.8–2.1: 1.5–2.0: 2.5–3.1. Smooth spiny mic at base of antennae 3 dorsal, 3 ventral on Ant. I, 1 internal, 1 external and 1 ventral on Ant. II. Long smooth straight chaetae absent on antennae. Distal Ant. II with 3 dorsal rod-like S-chaetae. Two internal S-chaetae of Ant. III organ slightly expanded. No apical bulb.

Th. II with 4 (m1, m2, m 2i , m 2i 2) medio-medial, 3 medio-lateral (m4, m 4i , m4p), 22–23 posterior mac, 1 ms and 2 sens; p4 and p 4i as mac ( Fig. 51 ). Th. III with 31–36 mac and 2 lateral sens ( Fig. 52 ). Abd. I with 8 (a1–3, m2–4, m 2i , m4p) mac, 1 ms and 1 sens. Abd. II with 3 (m3, m3e, m3ep) central, 1 (m5) lateral mac and 2 sens. Abd. III with 1 (m3) central, 3 (am6, pm6, p6) lateral mac, 1 ms and 2 sens ( Fig. 53 ). Abd. IV with 6 central (I, M, B4–5, A5–6), 6 lateral mac (F1, E2–4, E2p, D3), and at least 17 sens ( Fig. 54 ). Abd. V with 3 sens ( Fig. 55 ).
Ecology. In aphotic zone of cave.
Etymology . Named after the name “tiger” (Lao Hu in Chinese) of the cave.

Remarks. This new species is closest to two cave species
S. trogla
and
S. lipsae
in long mucronal spine, modified chaetae on lateral manubrium, dorsal cephalic chaetotaxy, pointed tenent hairs, mac of Th. III and Abd. III. It differs from them in mic r, X, X2 and X4 on ventral side of the head, claw structure, presence of mac m 2i 2 on Th. III, 8+8 mac on Abd. I, and 6+6 central mac on Abd. IV.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 38–47.
Sinella tigris
sp. nov.
: 38, clypeal chaetae; 39, dorsal cephalic chaetotaxy; 40, lateral process of labial palp; 41, labial and post-labial chaetotaxy; 42, trochanteral organ; 43, fore claw; 44, mid claw; 45, hind claw; 46, anterior face of ventral tube; 47, posterior face of ventral tube.

FIGURES 48–55.
Sinella tigris
sp. nov.
: 48, lateral flap of ventral tube; 49, manubrial plaque; 50, mucro; 51–55, tergal chaetotaxy; 51, Th. II; 52, Th. III; 53, Abd. I–III; 54, Abd. IV; 55, Abd. V.

,

Chen

and

Sinella minuta
sp. nov.
Figs 56–70, Table 2

subSubSection.paragraph:
Types .
Holotype : female on slide, China : Sichuan : Beichuan : Lin Fong village : Hua Jiao Ling : Zhang Jia Yan Kou Keng cave,
30.vii.2009
, Josiane Lips leg. (collection # CHI-Lips4103)
.
Paratypes : 2 female on slides and 18 in alcohol, same data as holotype
. Holotype and one paratype deposited in NJAU and others in MNHN.
Description. Body length up to 3.9 mm . Body whitish in alcohol.

Eyes absent. Labral papillae absent. Prelabral and labral chaetae 4/ 5, 5, 4, all smooth; median three chaetae of the first row longer than others. Clypeal chaetae smooth except middle one of the first row ( Fig. 57 ). Dorsal cephalic chaetotaxy with 8 sutural (S) and 4 mac in Gr. II ( Fig. 58 ). Papilla E with 4 guard chaetae; lateral process of labial palp as thick as normal chaetae, with tip reaching beyond apex of labial papilla. Subapical chaetae of maxillary outer lobe slightly larger than apical one; 3 smooth sublobal hairs on maxillary outer lobe. Labial chaetae as mrel1l2, all smooth; chaetae r, X, X2 and X4 as smooth tiny mic; chaeta X3 absent ( Fig. 59 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 56–65.
Sinella minuta
sp. nov.
: 56, distal part of Ant. IV, ventral view; 57, clypeal chaetae; 58, dorsal cephalic chaetotaxy; 59, labial and mental chaetotaxy; 60, trochanteral organ; 61, fore claw; 62, hind claw; 63–64, ventral tube. 63, anterior face; 64, posterior face and lateral flap; 65, manubrial plaque.

FIGURES 66–70. Tergal chaetotaxy in
Sinella minuta
sp. nov.
: 66, Th. II; 67, Th. III; 68, Abd. I–III; 69, Abd. IV; 70, Abd. V.

subSubSection.paragraph: Th. II with 4 (5) (m1, m 1i , m 2m , m 2i , m 2i 2) medio-medial, 3 medio-lateral (m4, m 4i , m4p), 24–26 posterior mac, 1 ms and 2 sens ( Fig. 66 ). Th. III with at least 35 mac and 2 lateral sens; a set of chaetae between p2+ and p2e+ sometimes present ( Fig. 67 ). Abd. I with 9–11 mac, 1 ms and 1 sens; m 4i , m4ip and m 2i 2 sometimes absent. Abd. II with 3 (m3, m3e, m3ep) central, 1 (m5) lateral mac and 2 sens. Abd. III with 1 (m3) central, 3 (am6, pm6, p6) lateral mac, 1 ms and 2 sens ( Fig. 68 ). Abd. IV with 6 (I, M, B4–5, A5–6) central and 6 (F1, E2–4, E2p, D3) lateral mac; number of sens unclear ( Fig. 69 ). Abd. V with 3 sens ( Fig. 70 ).
Ecology. In aphotic zone of cave.
Etymology. Name after the minor chaetae on the ventral side of head.

Remarks. This new species is characterized by tiny mic r, X, X2 and X4 on ventral side of head, absence of unpaired ungual tooth, truncate unguiculus with a small outer tooth, presence of mac m3p and m 2i 2 on Abd. I, and 6+6 central mac on Abd. IV. It is closest to
S. tigris
sp. nov.
in long mucronal spine, “smooth” inner differentiated tibiotarsal chaetae, pointed tenent hairs, and chaetotaxy of Abd. II‒Abd. IV, but differs from the latter in 9–11 mac on Abd. I and smooth tiny mic X, X2 and X4 ( Table 2 ).
